meanings.definition: Provide (someone) with a reason for doing something.
meanings.sent1: Encouraging words can motivate students to study harder.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk motivated the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The promise of ice cream can motivate kids to finish their homework.
meanings.sent4: The thought of success can motivate individuals to push beyond their limits.
meanings.sent5: A heartfelt thank you can be a powerful motivator for many people.

meanings.definition: Stimulate (someone's) interest in or enthusiasm for doing something.
meanings.sent1: Seeing her favorite singer in concert really motivated her to pursue her own music career.
meanings.sent2: The exciting plot of the book motivated him to read more novels.
meanings.sent3: The idea of winning a trophy motivated the team to train harder.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery motivated the artist to paint a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies can be a strong motivator to get out of bed in the morning.
